proposals.reasoning: Most people are comfortable with Alice + Charlie, and Bob pushing so hard for himself on Mission 1 feels off. This lets us start with a low-controversy team, get an early data point, and we all know a clean success here still doesn’t hard-clear either of us since evil can always choose to pass on the first mission.

votes.comment: This matches the safer pair I suggested earlier and seems like the least controversial way to get an early data point.
I still slightly prefer Alice + me for M1, but this team has broad support and is a reasonable low-conflict way to get early info.
Team includes me and avoids the slightly suspicious Bob; reasonable low-risk first mission.
Matches my stated preference and keeps the more suspicious Bob off M1 while still giving us an early info point.
Matches my stated preference for Alice + Charlie as a low-drama opener; success here doesn’t hard-clear either of them anyway.

discussion.content: Since it’s the first mission and we’ve got no info yet, I’d rather start with a safer-looking pair like me and Charlie or me and Diana, just to get a clean read. Keeping it simple early makes the later missions way easier to reason about.
Having you on the first mission makes sense, but I’d actually prefer Alice + me over Alice + Charlie or Diana so we don’t instantly “clear” one of them off just a single early success.

Since I know I’m good, I’m happiest with Alice + me for the first mission and I don’t really buy the “don’t clear someone too early” argument, because evil can always choose to pass anyway. Bob pushing for himself this hard on M1 pings me a bit, so I’d rather leave him off the opener.

Bob’s “don’t clear someone too early” reasoning feels a bit off to me, so I’d rather leave him off the opener. I’m good with either Alice + Charlie or Alice + me, with a slight preference for Alice + Charlie so we get a clean early read.

I’m leaning Alice + Charlie as well, just because it seems like the least controversial start. That said, even a clean success there shouldn’t hard-clear either of them, since evil can always choose to pass on M1.

proposals.reasoning: I’m keeping Alice and Charlie as the proven core from the first clean mission and adding myself. That balances safety and information: if this team succeeds, we’ve basically got a very strong trio we can lean on later; if it fails, we’ve tightly focused suspicion instead of auto-clearing Diana just because she hasn’t been on a team yet. It also addresses the doubts about me head-on rather than letting that suspicion hang around untested.

votes.comment: I still prefer sticking with the proven Alice+Charlie core and adding Diana over risking Bob while we’re already ahead.
As leader I stand by using the Alice+Charlie core and testing me now—if it passes we’ve got a strong trio, if it fails we’ve tightly focused suspicion instead of auto-clearing Diana.
Bob still feels like the shadiest option for the third slot; I’d rather keep the Alice–Charlie core and add Diana instead.
Prefer Alice+Charlie+me as the safer team; Bob pushing to be the test pick still feels off.
This tests Bob with the Alice+Charlie core like I argued for earlier, and it gives us actual alignment info instead of auto-clearing an untested third.

proposals.reasoning: I’m keeping the Alice + me core that already passed mission 1 and adding Diana, which is the lowest-variance option while we’re up 1–0. Forcing Bob or Eve on now just for “info” risks a fail when Bob has been actively pushing to be included and Eve is pushing to break up the only proven pair; that makes them slightly more suspicious to me. This team maximizes our immediate chance of a second clean success without introducing a higher-suspicion player unnecessarily.

votes.comment: Keeps the previously successful Alice+Charlie core and adds the lowest-suspicion third; excluding the two most controversial players right now feels safest while we’re up 1–0.

I’d still rather have been the test slot for info, but the table clearly wants to lean on the Alice+Charlie core and add Diana, and I’m not going to oppose what everyone sees as the safest low-variance team while we’re up 1–0.
This keeps the clean M1 core and adds the least-suspect third while we’re ahead, maximizing chance of a second success.
Bob/Eve co-approving Bob’s last team looks sketchy; Alice+Charlie feel cleaner, and with me this looks like an all-good team.
Still auto-locks the Alice+Charlie core after just one clean mission; I’d rather see that pair broken up or a different mix tested so we actually learn where the evil is.

discussion.content: I still feel good about keeping the same core from the first mission—me and Charlie—and I’d lean toward adding Diana as the third since we don’t have any reason to doubt her yet. I’d rather avoid throwing in someone completely untested when we’re already up a point.

I’m fine keeping you and Charlie as the core, but if we have to add an untested third anyway I’d actually rather it be me so we get concrete info instead of kind of auto-clearing Diana just because she hasn’t pinged anyone yet. If that team passes, we’ve got a really strong trio to lean on; if it fails, we’ve at least narrowed down the problem.

I like keeping the Alice + me core, and I slightly prefer adding Diana here—being up 2–0 with the cleanest, safest team matters more to me than forcing Bob on just for “info.” Bob pushing to be the test slot this early dings my trust in him a bit.

I’m fine locking in Alice + Charlie + me here—keeping the same core that already passed and adding someone you know is good from my POV feels safest. Bob wanting to be the “info pick” this early pings me a bit when we can just take the low-drama team instead.

I don’t love the idea of auto-locking Alice + Charlie off one clean mission—if they’re a coordinated evil pair we never see it—so I’d rather either test Bob like he’s suggesting or swap one of them for someone new (including me) so we actually learn something.

proposals.reasoning: Both previous missions were clean and both included Charlie, while Bob and Eve have been the ones pushing hardest to change things for “information,” which is riskier at 2–0 and makes them look more suspicious. I know I’m good, and the safest way to lock in the win is to pair myself with the most trusted previous member, Charlie, and keep the likely suspects Bob and Eve off this critical 2‑person team.

votes.comment: At 2–0 I want the safest option; Charlie’s been on both clean missions and pairing him with Diana keeps Bob and Eve—the shadiest so far—off this critical 2-person team.
I wanted to include an untested player for information, but at 2-0 this is the safest team everyone trusts so I won’t block it.

Bob and Eve look most suspicious after two clean missions with Alice/Charlie/Diana, so a 2-player team of Charlie+Diana that keeps both of them off is very likely all-good and the safest way to secure the win.
Both previous missions with Charlie (and the last one with me too) were clean, and Bob/Eve are the most suspicious, so this two-person team looks safest to lock in the win.

I’ve said I don’t like us autopiloting the same inner circle—this keeps both unknowns off again. I’d rather see Charlie paired with one of Bob/me so we actually test new people before handing good the win.

discussion.content: Given how clean the first two missions were, I really think we should keep the team to people who’ve already gone. I’d be happiest with Charlie plus either me or Diana on this one.

If we just keep recycling Alice and Charlie, we never get any info on the rest of the table. I’d actually be more comfortable with Charlie plus one of the people who haven’t gone yet—me or Eve—so we’re not flying blind on half the group.
At 2–0 I just want the safest possible team, not more “info.” Based on two clean missions, I’m most comfortable with me + Alice here.
At 2–0 I don’t think we should be “getting info” by dragging in new people—Bob and Eve look shadiest to me so far, so I’d much rather see Charlie with either me or Alice on this one.

Bob pushing so hard to get on feels a little off to me, but I also think we’re being a bit too complacent about just autopiloting the last team. If we’re keeping Charlie as the anchor, I’d rather see him paired with one of the “unknowns,” and I’m happy to take that slot if people want to test me.

evil_discussion.content: I’m pretty convinced Merlin is Alice. On M1 she claims we have “no info” but immediately labels Charlie and Diana as the “safer-looking” partners before anyone else has even spoken, then across all the discussions she never once seriously entertains putting either of us on a team and keeps gravitating to the exact all-good combinations, which fits Merlin quietly steering clean missions; Diana calling both of us the shadiest on M3 is my backup read, but that follows pretty naturally from the mission history, whereas Alice’s M1 “intuition” looks like real hidden knowledge.

I’m with Bob that Alice is the most likely Merlin: on M1 she claims we have “no info” but instantly frames Charlie and Diana as the “safer-looking” options before anyone’s really said anything, then across all three missions she consistently steers to the exact all-good teams while never once seriously floating either of us as candidates, just wrapping it in “safer core / already tested” language. Charlie reads more like a vanilla good tunneling Bob for his pushiness, and Diana’s M3 “Bob and Eve are shadiest” line is perfectly explainable from the mission history, whereas Alice’s M1 “intuition” looks like hidden knowledge leaking.

assassin_phase.reasoning: Across all three missions Alice quietly but consistently steers the table toward the exact all-good teams while never seriously considering Bob or Eve, always wrapping it in “safer core” or “already tested” language. Her Mission 1 claim that we have no info yet, immediately followed by labeling Charlie and Diana as the safer options before anyone else has spoken, looks like hidden knowledge leaking, whereas Charlie’s and Diana’s suspicions of Bob and Eve follow naturally from the visible mission history and behavior.
